wikitext.*:
[[File:Ralph Damiani - Andunie.png|thumb|''Andúnië'' by [[:Category:Images by Ralph Damiani|Ralph Damiani]]]]
The '''Lord of Andúnië''' was the [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] lord who ruled the shoreland region of [[Andustar]] in western [[Númenor]] from the great city of [[Andúnië]].<ref>{{UT|IMap}}</ref> 

==Description==
As rulers of one of the major regions of [[Númenor]], the Lords of Andúnië were members of the [[Council of the Sceptre]]. Being the chief councellors of the [[Kings of Númenor]], they were the second most honourable lords in the kingdom.<ref>{{UT|Wife}}, Note 23</ref><ref name="Akallabeth">{{S|Akallabeth}}</ref> From their beginning, these lords revered and were ever-loyal to the [[Kings of Númenor]]; in addition to this, they had great love for the [[Eldar]] and the [[Valar]].<ref name="Akallabeth"/>

Their symbol of office was a [[Sceptre of Annúminas|silver sceptre]] which was afterwards held by the [[Kings of Arnor]].<ref>{{App|Eriador}}</ref> The house inherited the [[Ring of Barahir]] (given by [[Tar-Elendil]] to his daughter [[Silmarien]]),<ref name="note">{{UT|Numenor}}, Note 2</ref> the original [[Elendilmir]] from [[Silmariën]],<ref name="Gladden">{{UT|Gladden}}</ref> and the [[palantíri]] of [[Amandil]] (gifted by the [[Eldar]]).<ref name=rings>{{S|Rings}}</ref>

==History==
[[Tar-Elendil]], the fourth [[King of Númenor]], was the first King whose eldest child was a daughter. [[Silmariën]], as a woman, could not receive the [[Sceptre of Númenor]] at the time because of the [[Law of Succession in Númenor|law of succession]] that then existed in the realm; she could not succeed her father as [[Queen of Númenor]] and instead her younger brother, [[Tar-Meneldur]], took up the Sceptre.<ref name="UTWife">{{UT|Wife}}</ref> Instead, Silmariën married [[Elatan|Elatan of Andúnië]] and their son was [[Valandil (Lord of Andúnië)|Valandil]], who became the first of the Lords of Andúnië.<ref name="UTWife"/>

When the [[Shadow]] fell on [[Númenor]], the Lords remained [[Faithful]] to the Valar and covertly gave aid to the other Faithful, but retained their office.<ref name="Akallabeth"/> They could not declare their true allegiance openly, but they attempted to dissuade the [[Kings of Númenor]] from their wickedness with wiser counsel.<ref name="Akallabeth"/>

In these dark times, [[Lindórië]], daughter of the 14th Lord of Andúnië, wed [[Gimilzagar]], a descendant of [[Tar-Calmacil]]. Lindórië bore a daughter, [[Inzilbêth]], and raised her in the ways of the Faithful. 

Once grown to womanhood Inzilbêth wed [[Ar-Gimilzôr]]<ref>{{UT|Kings}}, Ar-Gimilzôr</ref> and bore him two sons, [[Inziladûn]] and [[Gimilkhâd]]. She passed her Faithful ways on to her elder son Inziladûn, who took the throne as [[Tar-Palantir]]. He was the last Faithful King of Númenor.<ref name="Akallabeth"/>

[[Amandil]] was the last Lord of Andúnië and a dear friend of [[Ar-Pharazôn]] in their youth. He was stripped of his titles for supporting the Faithful when [[Sauron]] came to power in Númenor. The Lordship of Andúnië was not revived before the [[Downfall of Númenor|Downfall]] claimed Númenor.<ref name="Akallabeth"/> 

Before the Downfall, a family of Faithful related to [[Elendil]] settled in [[Belfalas]]. After the Downfall Elendil granted the title [[Princes of Dol Amroth|Prince]] to the lord of that family who had a stronghold on the high promontory of Dol Amroth. From that ancient family arose the [[House of Dol Amroth]] and its hereditary Princes.<ref name="prince">{{UT|Cirion}}, Note 39</ref>

[[Elendil]], son of [[Amandil]], escaped Númenor before the Downfall with his sons and followers. He and his sons [[Isildur]] and [[Anárion]] founded the kingdoms of [[Arnor]] and [[Gondor]] when they arrived in [[Middle-earth]]. Though the Lordship of Andúnië would never return, the House of its Lords lived on into the [[Fourth Age]] in the distant descendants of Elendil, [[Aragorn]] and his son [[Eldarion]].<ref name="note"/>

==Name of House==
All known descendants of Silmariën and Elatan are also descendants of Valandil, whose male-line descendants were known as the "House of Valandil."<ref>{{PM|V}}, ''Note on the marriage of Míriel and Pharazôn'', Text ''a'', pp. 159-160</ref> Later generations of the male-line descendants of Silmariën and Elatan were also named as members of the "House of the Lords of Andúnië."<ref>{{NM|P3xi}}, ''Author's notes'', Note 1</ref><ref>{{UT|3a}}, Note 2</ref><ref>{{UT|5}}, "XXIII Ar-Gimilzôr (Tar-Telemnar)"</ref>

==List of Lords==
*1. [[Valandil (Lord of Andúnië)|Valandil]] ({{SA|630}} – c. {{SA|870|n}})
*2-14. Unknown (''dates unknown'')
*15. [[Eärendur (Lord of Andúnië)|Eärendur]] (''dates unknown'')
*16. Unknown (''dates unknown'')
*17. [[Númendil]] (''dates unknown'')
*18. [[Amandil]] (sailed West {{SA|3316|n}})
